page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Earith,Bluntisham}and {Colne}are situated on the edge of the{fens.}Most of the land around is{farmland.}There are many{orchards}around the area. The {peat}is very good for farming because it is{fertile.}Another reason why there are many farms in our area is because the land is{flat.}The flatness gives plenty of room for growing{ {intensive crops}and for{grazing {cattle.} The{Great River Ouse}runs through Earith and sometimes in the winter, nearby{Bury Fen}is{flooded}and freezes over.Speed skaters come from all over the country to compete against each other.350 years ago a dutch engineer named Vermuyden built two drainage canals, the{Old}and{New Bedford {Rivers. } (Written by Carol Roffey aged 10 yrs.)
